summary: the highly pathogenic porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome virus (HP-PRRSV) has been responsible for several viral attacks in the Asian porcine industry since the first outbreak in china in 2006. high levels of proinflammatory cytokines are noted in the host peripheral blood. these are considered as the greatest contributors to the overall disease burden. Cortisol (A), CRH (B) and ACTH (C) were measured by the commercial ELISA kits. each point represents the mean values generated from all pigs on each DPI.
